title: Pentagon confirms intelligence sharing with Japan despite hacking rumours
description: The Washington Post has reported that Chinese hackers allegedly accessed Japan's defence networks, spurring concerns.

title: What’s behind the latest fighting in Ethiopia?
description: Rebels in Amhara have taken up arms against Ethiopia's military.

title: US Supreme Court reinstates ‘ghost gun’ rule struck down by lower court
description: US Department of Justice says more than 19,000 firearms without serial numbers were seized in crime probes in 2021.

title: Afghan central bank lacks independence from Taliban: US watchdog
description: It lacked independence from the Taliban, had deficiencies in anti-money laundering and countering 'terrorism' financing.

title: Syrian government extends permission for limited UN aid to opposition areas
description: Syrians in rebel-held northwest fear Assad may choke off badly needed aid as Damascus establishes sway over assistance.

title: Notorious Colombian drug trafficker Otoniel sentenced to 45 years in US
description: Dairo Antonio Usuga David, a leader in the Gulf Clan, has admitted to overseeing a vast network of criminal operations.

title: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan barred from politics for 5 years
description: Election watchdog order says Khan disqualified in line with his conviction for misdeclaration of assets.

title: Italy shocks banks with 40 percent windfall tax for 2023
description: The move comes after higher interest rates have yielded record profits for banks as the cost of loans has soared.

title: More than 1,000 evacuated in southern Portugal as wildfires rage
description: High temperatures and strong winds hamper battle against wildfires, with conditions expected to remain challenging.

title: Biden designates US national monument near Grand Canyon
description: Indigenous leaders, environmentalists welcome protection of more than 404,000 hectares near Grand Canyon National Park.

title: No quick fix to reverse ‘astonishing’ Antarctic sea ice loss: Scientists
description: This year's sea ice minimum is 20 percent lower than the average over the last 40 years, researchers say.

title: US military buildup in Gulf risks ‘dangerous’ Iran escalation: Analysts
description: Sending troops to deter Iran in the Gulf harkens back to Donald Trump's hardline policies against Tehran, experts say.

title: Rwanda genocide survivors criticise UN court’s call to halt suspect’s trial
description: Felicien Kabuga, who is nearly 90 and has dementia, is accused of encouraging and bankrolling the Rwanda genocide.

title: Ecuador beset by crime, economic woes ahead of presidential vote
description: Voters express scepticism as candidates promise to revitalise sluggish economy and tackle rising insecurity.

title: President Duda sets Poland parliamentary election date for October 15
description: Polls for the parliament's upper and lower houses come amid rising tensions on country's eastern borders.

title: Fighting in Sudan’s Omdurman intensifies as displaced tops 4 million
description: The army is trying to recapture territory lost to the RSF by taking back control of a bridge across the Nile.

title: July 2023 hottest month on record as heatwaves scorch Earth
description: Global average temperature for July confirmed to be highest on record of any month, Europe climate observatory says.

title: Israeli minister dismisses US ‘terror’ label after deadly settler attack
description: Avi Dichter brushes off US use of the term 'terror attack' to describe the killing of a Palestinian by settlers.

title: Canadian publishers seek antitrust probe of Meta blocking news
description: Meta's anticompetitive conduct will strengthen its dominant position in advertising & 'harm' Canadian journalism.

title: Bittersweet emotions in Morocco as historic Women’s World Cup run ends
description: Atlas Lionesses make history at World Cup, and despite 4-0 loss to France, Moroccans are optimistic about women's sport.

title: Sanctions, airspace closures hamper UN humanitarian efforts in Niger
description: UN aid agencies scramble to replace depleting aid stocks as regional sanctions start to kick in.

title: Opposition cries foul as Central African Republic okays tenure elongation
description: President Touadéra's rivals have said he is seeking life presidency of the Central African Republic.

title: Niger coup leaders rebuff diplomatic overtures from AU, ECOWAS
description: West African leaders expected to meet on Thursday to discuss response to generals who have deposed Niger's president.

title: Alaska’s bursting ice dam highlights threat of glacial floods worldwide
description: While little known in US, glacial flooding could threaten about 15 million people around the world, researchers say.

title: Women’s World Cup 2023: Fixtures and match schedule for quarterfinals
description: The four knockout matches will be played on August 11 and August 12.

title: UEFA postpones AEK Athens-Dinamo Zagreb match after fan killed in brawl
description: Dozens arrested, several injured in violent clashes between supporters of rival sides outside AEK's stadium.

title: France end Morocco’s Women’s World Cup run to advance to quarter-finals
description: France win 4-0 to end Morocco's historic World Cup run and set up quarter-final clash with Australia.

title: Man United’s Varane says players’ welfare ignored over added time rules
description: In new rules, referees will add the exact time lost in goal celebrations, substitutions or injuries to stoppage time.

title: Mourners gather in Ireland to bid farewell to Sinead O’Connor
description: Fans line waterfront in Bray to pay their respects as singer and activist's funeral procession passes by.

title: War-torn Sudan battered by torrential rains
description: Rains damage more than 500 houses in the country's north as the army and paramilitary forces engage in a bloody battle.

title: ‘Dramatic increase’ in Myanmar war crimes, UN probe finds
description: Crimes include sexual violence, indiscriminate or disproportionate targeting of civilians using bombs, UN report says.

title: Colombia reach first Women’s World Cup quarter-final with win over Jamaica
description: Usme's goal breaches Jamaica's solid defence to give Colombia 1-0 win and sets up a quarter-final clash with England.

title: Italian man crushed to death by falling cheese wheels
description: Dairy factory owner, 74, dies when shelves carrying 25,000 wheels of cheese collapse and bury him, authorities say.

title: ‘Carlsberg was discriminating against us on a national basis’
description: In 2014, a staffer asked that a photo of a convicted war criminal was removed from the premises. The legal saga goes on.

title: The Mumbai residents risking safety for affordable housing
description: Residents in one of the city's prime locations are determined to stay put in a government-owned, dilapidated building.

title: Israel demolishes refugee camp home of alleged Palestinian attacker
description: Israeli forces demolished the house of Abdelfattah Kharousheh, who was accused of killing two Israelis last February.

title: India court asks if Nuh demolitions were ‘an exercise of ethnic cleansing’
description: Over 300 homes, businesses and roadside shanties - mainly belonging to Muslims - were bulldozed after communal riots.

title: The rise, fall and rise again of Nuhu Ribadu, Nigeria’s new security chief
description: Will Ribadu, celebrated in his first stint in government, succeed in his second or see his reputation dip again?

title: Western Australia to scrap new law protecting Aboriginal heritage sites
description: The Aboriginal Cultural Heritage Act came into force on July 1 and is now being dropped after protests by landowners.

title: Two dead, over 700,000 left without power as storms batter eastern US
description: More than 1,700 US flights were cancelled and some 8,000 delayed, the FlightAware website says.

title: Chocolates and a chat: A peaceful response to Quran burnings in Sweden
description: Muslims present at the burnings refuse to be provoked as they hand out chocolates and seek dialogue with onlookers.

title: Tech groups back TikTok in lawsuit seeking to block Montana ban
description: Trade association and tech industry coalition argue ban undermines 'structure, design, and purpose of the internet'.

title: Morocco’s women football stars are winning against Western bias too
description: Their record run is defeating the Western media's efforts to stereotype Arab teams.

title: Australian police arrest 19 for child sex abuse offences after FBI tip-off
description: Australian police say they have rescued 13 children after investigation into 'sophisticated' online child abuse network.

title: China calls on Philippines to move grounded warship from disputed reef
description: China says the Philippines has 'ignored' repeated requests to remove 'stranded' warship from the Second Thomas Shoal.

title: China drafts rules for facial recognition tech amid privacy complaints
description: Cyberspace Administration of China says tech should only be used when there is a specific purpose, protective measures.

title: South Korea evacuates thousands from World Scout Jamboree as typhoon nears
description: More than 1,000 vehicles are moving the estimated 37,000 scouts ahead of the arrival of Tropical Storm Khanun.

title: Jollibee made Filipino food global. Some say it exported exploitation too
description: Former workers at New Jersey, US branch of fast-food chain say they were let go after demanding better conditions.

title: Carcinogens found at US nuclear missile sites as reports of cancer surface
description: Clean up operation ordered after unsafe levels of likely carcinogen found at underground nuclear missile launch sites.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 531
description: Here is the situation on Tuesday, August 8, 2023.
